head.title: Deli Mavens Weigh In On Pastrami Palaces

hedline.hl1: Deli Mavens Weigh In On Pastrami Palaces

abstract.p: Stanley Kushner letter on Joseph D'Agnese's May 28 article describes Kosher Nosh deli in Glen Rock, NJ; photo (S)0

block.p: In the article on kosher-style delis in New Jersey (''Cutting the Mustard,'' May 28), I was surprised to see the Kosher Nosh of Glen Rock omitted. It is always busy, and has, in addition to the restaurant portion, a retail counter for the purchase of all the salamis you can carry. I have one or two nitpicks about the article. In my neighborhood, we ate sandwiches that were spiced only with mustard, not Russian dressing, and the cole slaw mentioned is more popularly known as health salad, a cabbage concoction that is relatively sweet and lacks mayonnaise.
